definition: second tone
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
second tone in Mandarin/rising tone

sentences.english: as you hear it a second time it startles less.
sentences.chinese: 但聽到第二聲的時候，就沒那麼喫驚了。

sentences.english: When two 3rd tones are in succession, the first 3rd tone is pronounced as a 2nd tone.
sentences.chinese: 兩個第三聲連在一起時，前一個讀成第二聲。

definition: the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
phonetic change
variant Chinese character
second tone in Mandarin/rising tone
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
reading or phonetic value of a character
combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
meaning of a character
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
fourth tone in Mandarin/falling tone
word formation
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
